melting.correctionMethods
Class EntropyCorrection

java.lang.Object
  melting.correctionMethods.EntropyCorrection
All Implemented Interfaces:
CorrectionMethod
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ahsen01SodiumCorrection, Santalucia98_04SodiumCorrection, Tan06MagnesiumCorrection, Tan06SodiumCorrection, Tan07MagnesiumCorrection, Tan07MixedNaMgCorrection, Tan07SodiumCorrection
public abstract class EntropyCorrection
extends java.lang.Object
implements CorrectionMethod

This class represents a specific type of ion correction which corrects the entropy value. It implements the CorrectionMethod interface.

correctMeltingResults

public ThermoResult correctMeltingResults(Environment environment)
Description copied from interface: CorrectionMethod
This method is called to correct the computed melting temperature.

Specified by:
correctMeltingResults in interface CorrectionMethod
Returns:
ThermoResult which contains the corrected results (enthalpy, entropy and melting temperature).

isApplicable

public boolean isApplicable(Environment environment)
Description copied from interface: CorrectionMethod
Check if the environment chosen by the user is a applicable with the correction model.

Specified by:
isApplicable in interface CorrectionMethod
Returns:
false if the correction method can't be used with the Environment. If the environment can make the results less reliable, a warning message will appear.
